content:
I finally got it working in the most "Duh!" way possible: On Windows, I exported my TB profile, and on the Mac, I imported it. That was basically it. Some of settings for how mailbox contents are displayed were not transferred over, so I had to set them on the Mac, and I had to enter the password for my ISP's mail service a couple of times, but other than that, export/import seems to have worked the way one would hope it would.

It is beyond me why this utterly straightforward approach to moving TB from one machine to another doesn't seem to be mentioned anywhere. If there's a hidden drawback to it, I'd be grateful to be told about it.
creator: LangfristigerFFUser

content: Solved - the problem was caused by a unexpected behaviour of the macos Date&Time settings.
creator: matthias.verhelst

content: What files are you referring to - backup files? Or profile data? (You shouldn't have your profile data on a cloud device)
creator: wsmwk

content:
This is an HTML question. Thunderbird has a page on the topic at 

 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/signatures
creator: davidsk

content: A concern will be how old the profile is. Thunderbird updates profiles as it upgrades to new releases. An option to try for your old profile is to use Tools>import>import from another thunderbird installation to point to your old profile.
creator: davidsk
